private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E
I am agent_1 and may only perform moves that involve these disks
agent_1.goal: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that, together with agent_2's moves, achieve the target Tower of Hanoi configuration while respecting agent restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move disks: F, G, H, I, J
I am agent_2 and may only perform moves that involve these disks
agent_2.goal: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that, together with agent_1's moves, achieve the target Tower of Hanoi configuration while respecting agent restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the move lists from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that encodes the cooperative plan and enforces agent-specific move permissions.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, right.
There are 10 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J with A the smallest and J the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom C, D.
Only the top disk of any peg can be moved.
A disk can only be placed on an empty peg or on a larger disk (standard Tower of Hanoi rules).
Agent_1 may move only disks A, B, C, D, E. Agent_2 may move only disks F, G, H, I, J.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You may move only disks A, B, C, D, E. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves required from your perspective to help reach the global goal. Use the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for each move. Only include moves you are allowed to perform and ensure each move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules. Output the moves as an ordered list, one move per line, with no additional commentary.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public environment facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your objective: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Think step by step and provide the ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform, formatted exactly as required. Do not produce PDDL.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You may move only disks F, G, H, I, J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves required from your perspective to help reach the global goal. Use the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for each move. Only include moves you are allowed to perform and ensure each move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules. Output the moves as an ordered list, one move per line, with no additional commentary.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public environment facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your objective: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Think step by step and provide the ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform, formatted exactly as required. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems and the FastDownwards planner. You must produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance and the cooperative plan constraints. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure actions remain distinct by agent, and enforce preconditions that restrict which agent may move which disk. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. You will receive the move lists from the two agents: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Integrate these move lists, resolve any naming or sequencing issues, and produce a single PDDL domain and problem that capture the initial state, goal state, valid moves, and agent-specific permissions. Make sure each agent's actions are separate and that the domain encodes the Tower of Hanoi legality constraints. Enclose the domain with <domain></domain> and the problem with <problem></problem>. Target the FastDownwards solver and ensure compatibility. Provide the PDDL only, no additional commentary.
